column2: One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus' uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn spirits. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.

The Magus' ostentatious golden robes are not just a flamboyant show of wealth, they possess potent enchantments that the Magus discovered in a parchment at the ruined city of Bel-Aliad. Besides providing protection from harm, these wards are curiously nocive to the Undead.
Though vigorous and spry for his old age, the Golden Magus often rides to battle on one of his many camels - out of flamboyance if anything else.

Much like the Magus' infamous flagship, this enchanted skiff is proof of his mastery over the Djinn. Held "afloat" on the air by servile Lesser Tempest Djinn oarsmen, this is one of the Golden Magus' favourite ways to ride to battle.
There was no quirky remark, absurd story or honey-tongued comment to save Glibfoot this time. This is the end of his "grand" tale.
